intro: Reseda gussonei, commonly known as the desert mignonette, is a flowering plant native to the arid regions of the southwestern United States and northern Mexico. It belongs to the family Brassicaceae, which includes many other mustard family plants. The plant is characterized by its small, bright yellow flowers that bloom in late spring to early summer. Reseda gussonei typically grows in rocky soils and is adapted to withstand drought conditions. Its foliage is usually gray-green, with narrow, linear leaves that help reduce water loss.
